alert.note: Alert for Mercer (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 7:48PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...western Mercer County * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar continued to indicate moderate rain due to thunderstorms. Any minor flooding will persist and slowly diminish through 9pm. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hermitage, Sharon, Sharpsville, Greenville, Farrell, Clark and Wheatland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
